title: zero_(mega_man)
body:
[b]Zero[/b] ([b]ゼロ[/b]) is one of the three main characters of the [[Mega Man X (series)|]] series, as well as the protagonist of the [[Mega Man Zero (series)|]] series. He is voiced by [[Okiayu Ryoutarou]][tn](Jp)[/tn].

A high ranking Maverick Hunter in the X series and a legendary freedom fighter in the [[Mega Man Zero (series)|Zero series]], he's a die hard warrior who doesn't hesitate to take action. However, behind his cold and emotionless attitude lies a wounded soul.

He was created by [[Dr. Wily (mega man)|Dr. Albert W. Wily]] during the [[Mega Man (classic)|classic Mega Man]] series. As such, his designation is DWN-∞ (Infinity). [spoiler]He had the Maverick Virus contained inside the gem in his head. When [[Sigma (mega man)|]] smashed the gem, he was infected by the Maverick Virus. Subsequently, Zero no longer showed any signs of Maverick behavior while Sigma became a Maverick.[/spoiler]

h4. Appearance

* !post #4212047: Default
* !post #3897008: [[Black Zero (mega man)|]]
* !post #4356478: [[Absolute Zero (mega man)|]] ([[Mega Man X: Command Mission]])
* !post #5306095: [[Zero Nightmare (mega man)|]] ([[Mega Man X6]])
* !post #5656446: [[DiVE Armor Zero (mega man)|]] ([[Mega Man X DiVE]])
* !post #7607343: [[Zero(Z) (mega man)|]] ([[Mega Man Zero (series)|]] series)

h4. See also
* [[Bliss Zero (mega man)|]], a [[genderswap]]ped version of Zero from [[SVC Chaos]].
* [[Model Z (mega man)|]], [[biometal]] from [[Mega Man ZX]].
* [[Via (mega man)|]], [[Mega Man X Dive|X DiVE]] character similar in appearance to Zero.
* [[Zero.exe (mega man)|]], his counterpart in the [[Mega Man Battle Network (series)|]] series.
* [[List of Mega Man characters]]

title: type_97_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the Chinese [[QBZ-97]] [[assault rifle]], the export version of QBZ-95, in [[Girls' Frontline]].

Type 97 has very [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair]] in [[twintails]] and [[red eyes]]. Her normal costume consists of a [[white shirt]] with black [[double-breasted]] [[underbust]], white [[pleated skirt]], [[white thighhighs]], and black [[boots]] as well as a black [[cape]].

Portrayed as a cheerful yet somehow childish girl eager for the outside world, but under strict guardianship by her older sister, [[Type 95 (girls' frontline)|]]. This reflects the real-world plight that the QBZ-97 never found itself popular in the civilian market as expected, due to its mixed reputation and import restrictions.

In the prequel spin-off game, [[Girls' Frontline Neural Cloud|Neural Cloud]], Type 97 appears as [[Jiangyu (neural cloud)|]], and [[Jiangyu (girls' frontline 2)|she does so too]] in the sequel, [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]].

Voiced by [[Sakura Ayane]]. 
Illustrated by [[Kishiyo]] (Original, Peony), and [[Nagu]] (Late for School, Gretel the Witch).

h4. Appearance

title: eyecatch
body:
In manga, the leading hero image on the first page of a chapter.

In anime, the stills before and after the commercial break in the middle of the show and usually illustrated by the production studio doing the show or official illustrators of the series. Often bears the show's logo.

They sometimes loosely relate to the chapter/episode, but are sometimes just unrelated fan service.

h4. See also 

* [[end card]]
* [[anime screenshot]]
* topic #6487
* forum #95355

title: super_princess_peach
body:
A [[Princess Peach]]-themed spin-off to the [[Mario (Series)|Super Mario]] franchise, released on the [[Nintendo DS]] in 2005.

In a role reversal [[Mario]] is the one kidnapped by [[Bowser]], along with [[Luigi]] and multiple [[Toad_(mario)|]]s. With the help of [[Perry_(mario)|Perry]], a living umbrella with amnesia, she sets off to rescue them and confront Bowser who wields the [[Vibe Scepter]].

h4. See also

* [[Princess Peach: Showtime!]] (another Princess Peach-themed game)

h4. External Links

* "Super Mario Wiki: Super Princess Peach":[https://www.mariowiki.com/Super_Princess_Peach]

title: walther_ppk
body:
The [b]Walther PP[/b] ([i]Polizeipistole[/i]) is a double-action semi-automatic [b][[handgun]][/b] of German origin, designed in 1929 and manufactured by Carl Walther GmbH Sportwaffen. Its compact size and blowback operation influenced some pistol designs like the [[Makarov PM]].
Available in different variants and [[handgun cartridge|pistol cartridges]], the most prominent one is the shortened [b]Walther PPK[/b] ([i]Kurz[/i]) which is associated with [[James Bond]] franchise.

h4. See also

* [[List of weapons]]
* [[PPK (Girls' Frontline)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Walther PP":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walther_PP

title: fly_me_to_the_star_(revue_starlight)
body:
Posts that directly reference or parody frames from the [[Shoujo Kageki Revue Starlight]] TV Anime ending sequence, drawn by the artist [[Mebachi]].

References to the first half of the ED usually portrait [[floating]] or [[falling]] characters on a [[blurry background|blurry]] [[grey background]] with [[floating object|floating objects]], usually followed by a [[close-up]], although the first frames depict an [[upper body]] of character [[facing viewer|facing]] or [[looking at viewer]] if alone, or two characters [[face-to-face|facing]] and/or [[eye contact|looking at each other]].

The second half consist in a [[tall image]] with [[curtains]], a [[starry sky]] and characters lined up vertically, followed by a [[full body]] frame of the focus character(s) under the [[spotlight]].

h4. Notable examples
h6.First half
* !asset #25716646: A solo character ([[Kagura Hikari]]) [[facing viewer|facing]] and then [[looking at viewer]] - Ep.3
* !asset #25716660: Two characters ([[Kagura Hikari]] and [[Aijou Karen]]) [[face-to-face|facing]] and then [[eye contact|looking at each other]] - Ep.4
* !asset #25716700: Pair characters ([[Kagura Hikari]] and [[Aijou Karen]]) [[floating]]/[[falling]] - Ep.4
* !asset #25716392: [[close-up]] frame - Ep.4
h6.Second half
* !asset #25716517: Full lenght scroll with all the Seisho protagonists
* !asset #25716394: Ending frame with pair characters ([[Kagura Hikari]] and [[Aijou Karen]]) under the [[spotlight]] - Ep.4

title: age_of_empires_ii
body:
The second game in the Age of Empires series, covering the time period between the dark ages (5th century) to the early renaissance (15th century). Originally focusing on civilizations of the Eurasian landmass, later expansion packs also covered civilizations of the Americas as well as Africa.

h4. See also

* [[Age of Empires (series)]]

title: male_robin_(valentine)_(fire_emblem)
body:
Tag used for [[Male robin (fire emblem)|]] in his attire in the 2022 "Here With Me":https://feheroes.fandom.com/wiki/Here_with_Me_(Focus) [[Fire Emblem Heroes]] banner (as duo unit of [[Chrom (valentine) (fire_emblem)]]).

It is possible that he may have been drawn in a valentine context before the appearance of the banner or with a different outfit, in which case the tag should not be used.

TBU

title: female_robin_(seaside_tactician)_(fire_emblem)
body:
[[female robin (fire emblem)|Female Robin]] from [[Fire Emblem Awakening]] when dressed in her summer attire from [[Fire_Emblem_Heroes]]' 2017 "Ylissean Summer":[https://feheroes.fandom.com/wiki/Ylissean_Summer_(Focus)] banner. 

The Robin unit using this outfit is officially known as [i]Robin: Seaside Tactician[/i]

Can typically be identified thanks to the outfit's characteristics: a purple [[o-ring bikini]] with a large [[coat]] draped over it, a brown [[belt]], large brown [[boots]], a large [[net]] containing [[fish]], and a [[basket]] containing an [[octopus]].

Likely to include her weapon from the game, a large [[harpoon]] with a [[fish]] skewered on its points.

Note that it's possible (especially in older artwork) to depict Female Robin in a swimsuit without it being the one described above, in which case this tag should not be used.

title: female_robin_(valentine)_(fire_emblem)
body:
Tag used for [[Female robin (fire emblem)|]] in her attire in the 2022 "Here With Me":https://feheroes.fandom.com/wiki/Here_with_Me_(Focus) [[Fire Emblem Heroes]] banner.

It is possible that she may be drawn in a valentine context before the appearance of the banner or with a different outfit, in which case the tag should not be used.

TBU

title: robin_(fire_emblem)
body:
A customizable character in [[Fire Emblem Awakening]]. Can be [[male robin (fire emblem)|male]] or [[female robin (fire emblem)|female]]. Default gender is male and default name (which is also the name given to the character in [[Super Smash Bros.]] for 3DS/Wii U) is [b]Robin[/b] ([b]Rufure[/b]/[b]Reflet[/b] in the Japanese version). Has little memory of the past, but is a gifted tactician.

Also known in the English versions as an [b]Avatar[/b].

h4. Appearance

* !post #2716653: [[male robin (fire emblem)|Male]]
* !post #2716656: [[female robin (fire emblem)|Female]]

title: female_alear_(awoken_divinity)_(fire_emblem)
body:
An [[official_alternate_costume|alternate costume]] of [[female alear (fire emblem)|female Alear]], used for her advanced class form of divine dragon in [[fire_emblem_engage|Fire Emblem Engage]] and as a base outfit in [[fire_emblem_heroes|Fire Emblem Heroes]].

Using the default outfit as a base, it adds some modifications, such as replacing her silver [[crown_braid|crown braid]] with a [[gold|golden]] one, [[arm_armor|armouring up the sleeves]] and adding a [[armored_skirt|partially armoured skirt]] on the left and right sides and lastly decorating her [[upper_body|upper torso]] area a bit and adding a few [[gold_trim|gold trims]] to the [[miniskirt|miniskirt]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #6641047

body:

They have [[male alear (fire emblem)|male]] and [[female alear (fire emblem)|female]] versions.

Outstanding features include their [[multicolored hair|multicolored]] [[blue hair| blue]] and [[red hair|red]] hair along with [[blue eyes|blue]] and [[red eyes|red]] [[heterochromia|heterochromic]] eyes.

title: apocrypha/inheritance_of_glory
body:
[b]Apocrypha/Inheritance of Glory[/b]
[quote]A voice heard in a dream.

"Fated one who carves out their own destiny...answer my call."

The voice goes on. Another world is in crisis, and needs help if it is to be saved.
Following the mysterious voice, you participate in a strange reproduction of a Holy Grail War that has broken out in a land devoid of human reason.[/quote]

A collaboration event in [[Fate/Grand Order]] with [[Fate/Apocrypha]], released on the Japanese server on April 29, 2018 and on the NA server on April 24, 2020. [[Sieg (fate)|]] is given as a reward to players for completing the event.

title: francis_(taimanin_asagi)
body:
[[taimanin_(series) | Taimanin]] character. Appeared in [[taimanin_rpgx | Taimanin RPGX]] and [[action_taimanin | Action Taimanin]].

An [[oni]] from the demon realm currently living in the human world after being banished from her home. Uses guns, grenades, a large cleaver-like blade, and a [[kanabou ]] that has been decorated with beads. She likes [[gyaru]] fashion.

Originally designed by [[saijou_satoru]].

title: screwllum_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A recurring character from [[Honkai: Star Rail]], but remains unplayable. 

He is portrayed in a [[robot]]ic form; his default outfit consists of a [[black vest]] and [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[black jacket]] worn over a [[white shirt]], [[red ascot]], [[black gloves]], [[white pants]], single [[thigh strap]] on his left leg, [[black hat|black]] [[fedora]], golden [[monocle]], and [[white shoes]].

title: victory_pose
body:
A victory pose is a [[pose]] assumed by a person to celebrate victory, particularly by athletes and other sportspeople. Victory poses often involve raising the arms in the air.

h4. See also

* [[v]]

title: tachibana_kanade
body:
A character from [[Angel Beats!]], primarily known as Angel/Tenshi. Voiced by [[Hanazawa Kana]]. 

She is the acting Student Council president and antagonist to the Shinda Sekai Sensen (Afterlife War Front).  She is capable of performing various supernatural abilities called "Guard Skills", such as summoning out of thin air blades from her forearms.  She is sometimes depicted with [[white wings]], while her main physical attributes are [[long hair|long]] [[light blue hair|light blue]] or [[aqua hair]] and [[yellow eyes]].

title: mapo_tofu
body:
A spicy Szechuan (Sichuan) dish with [[tofu]] in a red chili and bean sauce.

The original Chinese [i]mapo doufu[/i] is characterized by its "mala sauce":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mala_sauce]. The Japanese version, popularized by the Japanese chef "Chen Kenmin":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chen_Kenmin], lacks "Sichuan pepper":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sichuan_pepper] flavor.

Brought to light by [[Kotomine Kirei]]'s "Extra Spicy Mapo Tofu" featured in [[Fate/Stay Night]] and later featured as [[Craft Essence (fate)|]] in [[Fate/Grand Order]], as well as a seemingly inconsequential reference in episode 5 of [[Angel Beats!]] involving [[Tachibana Kanade]]. 

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Food tags]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Mapo Tofu":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mapo_tofu

title: frozen_(disney)
body:
An American animated musical fantasy film produced by [[Disney|Walt Disney Animation Studios]] and originally released in 2013. Its plot follows a young girl named [[Anna (Frozen)|]] who, accompanied by an iceman named [[Kristoff (Frozen)|]] and an anthropormorphic snowman named [[Olaf (Frozen)|]], attempts to find her estranged sister Elsa after she accidentally freezes the kingdom of Arendelle in an eternal winter with her ice powers. 

In 2019, the film was followed by a sequel, [i][[Frozen II (disney)|]][/i].

h4. Characters

* [[Anna (Frozen)|]]
* [[Elsa (Frozen)|]]
* [[Hans (Frozen)|]]
* [[Kristoff (Frozen)|]]
* [[Olaf (Frozen)|]]
* [[Idunn (Frozen)|]]
* [[Agdar (Frozen)|]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Frozen (2013 film)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frozen_(2013_film)]

title: sukue!_amazones.com
body:
[b]Save Amazones.com! ~CEO Crisis 2020~[/b]
[quote]All Servants, roll out!
Amazones.com, the largest shopping service in the Universe, has seen all of its employees mysteriously vanish overnight...
How could this happen to the company with the very best benefits package?
Amazones.com's CEO now faces the prospect of imminent bankruptcy.
To save Amazones.com, Chaldea has formed a temp agency to aid the company's delivery service!
The renewed Pagoda event is now open![/quote]

A limited time event in [[Fate/Grand Order]], released on the Japanese server on January 22, 2020 and on the NA server on January 18, 2022.

h4. Craft Essence
* !post #3765600: Therapeutic Spa

h4. See Also
* [[List of Fate/Grand Order events]]

title: nightingale_no_christmas_carol
body:
[b]Christmas 2019: Nightingale's Christmas Carol[/b]
[quote]Christmas is always a busy time for Chaldea.
Not only are there presents and cakes to prepare, but also a new Santa to be selected. This year's Santa, bringing gifts of good health to all, is also just the one to rein the Servants running wild at the Rayshift site.

"Christmas needs a Santa, just as the ill need a nurse. And, of course, a Singularity requires you, Master."[/quote]

A limited time [[Christmas]] event in [[Fate/Grand Order]], released on the Japanese server on November 28, 2019 and on the NA server on December 14, 2021. [[Florence Nightingale (Santa) (fate)|]] is given as a reward to players for completing the event.

h4. Craft Essences
* !post #9036554: Maidens' Luncheon
* !post #9036599: Deliverers of Sentiment
* !post #9036642: With My Family
* !post #9036679: Traces of Christmases Past

h4. See Also
* [[List of Fate/Grand Order events]]
other_names: ナイチンゲールのクリスマス・キャロル

title: battle_in_new_york_2019
body:
[b]Battle in New York 2019[/b]
[quote]To earn the honor of being known as the strongest Servant, the Heroic Spirits once again assemble in the golden city of New York! This annual contest of strength has become a traditional festival among Chaldea's Servants.
The audience screams for their champions as the endless deathmatches rage and both friendships and rivalries are formed!

And just as the grand contest that has been witness to so many legendary bouts nears its end, the fevered excitement of the festival reaches the very stars!

"Okay now. So is it finally my turn to shine?"

As the goddess's cry echoes across the skies, a close encounter of the third kind brings "Battle in New York 2019" into a whole new realm![/quote]
[expand=Original Description]
[quote]To earn the honor of being known as the strongest Servant, the Heroic Spirits once again assemble in the golden city of New York!
Who will rise to the top in this tournament, where only the mightiest reign supreme?

The magnificent festival of martial arts, where ranks and titles mean nothing, and all is ruled by the clash of raw strength!
"Battle in New York 2019" begins now![/quote]
[/expand]

A limited time event in [[Fate/Grand Order]], released on the Japanese server on September 18, 2019 and on the NA server on September 2, 2021.

h4. Craft Essences
* !post #9032955: Round and Round
* !post #9032964: Fly Off
* !post #3635167: From Uruk
* !post #9032982: Jewel Bride
* !post #9032998: Scenic Beauty

h4. See Also
* [[Battle in New York 2018]]
* [[Battle in New York 2022]]
* [[List of Fate/Grand Order events]]

title: rise_of_the_reds
body:
A modification of the Command & Conquer: Generals Zero Hour mod. Includes 2 new factions that were going to be originally in the game but was cut due to publishing reasons.

The modifications include 2 new factions: Europe (ECA) and Russia (Russian Federation) as well as modifying the latter 3 Factions: USA China and GLA with more sophisticated units.


As of 2025, the mod is in production works and will be posting new articles in weeks. (1.9)

title: kenzan!_las_vegas_gozenjiai
body:
[b]Dazzling Casino Out West: Las Vegas[br]All In! Las Vegas Championship Match ~ Seven Duels of Swordbeauties![/b]
[quote]Summertime is starting to affect the Servants again.
That's right, the summer tradition returns...
Swimsuit season is upon us!

The stage is set in Las Vegas.
The actors, the Swordbeauties, clad in gorgeous swimsuits.
The story, a heated conflict promising dazzling sums of QP!
This is the tale of Seven Duels of Swordbeauties!

Come on down and place your bets; the fight for the crown and the title of "Strongest Swordbeauty" is about to begin![/quote]

A limited time [[Summer]] event in [[Fate/Grand Order]], released on the Japanese server on August 14, 2019 and on the NA server on July 29, 2021. [[Katsushika Hokusai (Swimsuit Saber) (fate)|]] is given as a reward to players for completing the event.

title: jousting
body:
A [[medieval]] combat sport involving two participants riding a [[horse]] and [[charging forward]] into their opponents using a wooden [[lance]]. The one who managed to knock their opponent out of their steed is declared the winner. It is a common pastime activity among [[knight]]s and nobility during this period.

Note that this tag is also applicable to an actual [[duel]] where two participants are charging towards each other with their [[polearm]]s.

title: meikai_no_merry_christmas
body:
[b]Merry Christmas in the Underworld[/b]
[quote]Even though Christmas is just fast approaching, Chaldea has been struck by a scorching heat wave!
As the temperature climbs past 107°F, staff members collapse from the heat, and even the Servants have come down with a mysterious fever...

The sole Servant untouched by this odd affliction insists that the only one who can resolve the bizarre weather and illness is Master...
With only half a day left until destruction, will Chaldea survive to see another Christmas?[/quote]

A limited time [[Christmas]] event in [[Fate/Grand Order]], released on the Japanese server on December 15, 2017 and on the NA server on December 16, 2019. [[Altera the Santa (fate)|]] is given as a reward to players for completing the event.

h4. Characters

title: halloween_strike!
body:
[b]Ultra Skyscraper Castle: Csejte Pyramid Himeji Castle[br]Halloween Strike! Demonic Climb: Himeji Castle War[/b]
[quote]"Trick or torture! It's that time of year again.
I hope all my lonely little pumpkins are doing all right...
The parade route's planned! Treats for the village kiddies are prepared!
Now I just have to send this invitation to Chaldea!
My third special concert is about to—Huh? What's that? Huuuh?
Am I seeing things?! Hey! EEEEEEEEEEEEK!!!"

The voicemail message cuts off there.
Something is happening.
Something...terrifying...[/quote]

A limited time [[Halloween]] event in [[Fate/Grand Order]], released on the Japanese server on October 25, 2017 and on the NA server on October 23, 2019. Players can choose between [[Mecha Eli-chan (fate)|]] and [[Mecha Eli-chan Mk.II (fate)|]] as a reward for completing the event.

title: pouch
body:
Broad term for various small containers usually made from leather, textiles, or plastic. Objects called pouches include:

* A small non-rigid [[bag]] usually with a [[drawstring]] for holding or carrying things.
* A small semi-rigid container closed with a [[zipper]].
* A [[pocket]]-like semi-rigid container with a flap that folds over the opening. Pouches of this type may be designed to be worn like a belt, in which case they are tagged [[belt pouch]].

h4.See also

* [[thigh pouch]]

title: shi_jin_(fate)
body:
Accompanies [[Eliza The Nine-tattooed Dragon (fate)|]] as her draconic three-sectioned staff. He was a Servant summoned with [[Elizabeth Bathory (fate/extra)|Lancer Elizabeth Bathory]], but they were defeated in battle. Shi Jin decided to impart his Spirit Origin to Elizabeth, fusing them together into the Nine-Tattoo Dragon Eliza.

Shi Jin is one of the 108 Stars of Destiny from [i]Water Margin[/i], specifically the Minute Star (#23 of the 36 Heavenly Stars), known as "Nine-Tattoo Dragon" for the many dragon tattoos on his body. Elizabeth Bathory herself is affiliated with dragons due to her family using the fang of a dragon as its family crest, so those aspects are fused together into their Pretender version.

title: glitch_text
body:
Glitch text, is digital text that has been modified with numerous combining characters, Unicode symbols used to add diacritics above or below letters, to appear frightening or glitchy.

Named for a 2004 Internet creepypasta story that ascribes it to the influence of an eldritch deity, Zalgo text has become a significant component of many Internet memes, particularly in the "surreal meme" culture. The formatting of Zalgo text also allows it to be used to halt or impair certain computer functions, whether intentionally or not.


Create stunning AI-generated glitch text effects in seconds

https://glitchtextgenerator.app/

title: henshin
body:
[b]Henshin[/b] (変身, lit. "transformation") is the term for the [[transformation]] sequences commonly seen in [[tokusatsu]], [[mecha]], and [[magical girl]] anime where a character transforms from their ordinary form into a more powerful form. The term is derived from Kafka's [[The Metamorphosis]].

Although some speculate that the "[[Henshin pose]]" originates from kabuki or cheerleading, the original inspiration is unclear.

h4. See also

* [[henshin pose]]
* [[transformation]]

h4. External links

* "TVTropes: Transformation Sequence":https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TransformationSequence

title: the_metamorphosis
body:
[b]The Metamorphosis[/b], also known simply as [b]Metamorphosis[/b] (German: [b]Die Verwandlung[/b]) is a [[fantasy]] novella written by "Franz Kafka":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franz_Kafka which was first published in 1915. 

One of Kafka's best-known works, Metamorphosis tells the story of young deserting and unemployed salesman [[Gregor Samsa]], who due to lack of money lives with his parents and wakes one morning to find himself inexplicably transformed into a huge insect (German: [i]ungeheueres Ungeziefer[/i], lit. "monstrous vermin") and subsequently struggles to adjust to this new condition. 

The novella has been widely discussed among literary critics, with differing interpretations being offered. In popular culture and adaptations of the novella, the insect is commonly depicted as a [[cockroach]]. The Japanese translation's title would inspire the coining of [[henshin]] in [[tokusatsu]] contexts.
other_names: 変身(フランツ・カフカ)

title: choudenshi_bioman
body:
The 8th [[Super Sentai]] series.

After [[Marvel]]'s attempt with [[Taiyou Sentai Sun Vulcan]], Haim Saban would make his first attempt at pitching an American Sentai adaptation with "Bioman":[https://lostmediawiki.com/Bio-Man_(partially_found_unaired_pilot_of_Haim_Saban_adaptation_of_%22Choudenshi_Bioman%22_Super_Sentai_TV_series;_1986)]. Elements of Bioman would be carried over into the eventual adaptation in [[Mighty Morphin Power Rangers]], such as [[Peebo]] inspiring [[Alpha 5]] and the earliest instance of [[Zordon]]'s name. He would try again with [[Kyouryuu Sentai Zyuranger]], which would be successfully adapted.

title: mamehinata
body:
[[Mamehinata]] is an original 3D character created by [[Mochiyama Kingyo]] in [[VRChat]].

She is a [[dog girl]] with [[brown hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her hair features an [[ahoge]] and a [[hairpin]], and she wears a [[visor cap]].

Her upper body attire includes a large [[belt collar]] and a [[short over long sleeves]] [[shirt]], with an outer [[red shirt]] and an inner [[white shirt]]. Her lower attire is a pair of [[black shorts]].

Her legs are covered in [[loose socks]] and she wears [[blue shoes]]. Mamehinata also has a small backpack on her back, which is not usually visible, with only the shoulder strap visible on the front.

title: dirndl
body:
A dirndl is a type of traditional [[dress]] worn in Bavaria, Liechtenstein, Austria and South Tyrol, based on the historical costume of Alpine peasants. An iconic outfit for female [[beer]] [[waitress|servers]] during [[Oktoberfest]].

A dirndl consists of a [[bodice]] and [[skirt]] or a [[pinafore dress]], a low-cut [[blouse]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], and a [[waist apron]].

The position of the [[apron]] [[bow]] can indicate a woman's marital status:

* Bow on left: [b]Single[/b]
* Bow on right: [b]Married[/b]
* Bow in middle: [b]Virgin[/b]
* Bow in back: [b]Widow[/b] [i](or waitress)[/i]

h4. See also

* [[German clothes]]
* [[Lederhosen]]
* [[Oktoberfest]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Dirndl":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dirndl

title: prototype_stark_jegan
body:
A fictional giant manned military robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]RGM-89S Prototype Stark Jegan[/b]

An [[Earth Federation]] early proposal for the [[Stark Jegan]] developed by [[Anaheim Electronics]]. Armed with massive anti-ship missiles, the Prototype Stark Jegan had a two-seater elongated cockpit and two Machine Cannons in its redesigned chest. 

While this long-range assault variant eventually was passed on in favor of the more well-rounded definitive Stark Jegan, it had combat prowess, and saw action as part of the [[Nahel Argama]]'s "Band of Misfit Mobile Suits" squad.
other_names: プロト・スタークジェガン

title: blame!
body:
[i]Blame![/i], pronounced "blam", is a seinen manga [[cyberpunk]]/[[science fiction]]/[[goth fashion|gothic]] [[horror (theme)|Horror]] series by artist [[Nihei Tsutomu]], originally published in Kodansha's [b]Afternoon[/b].

The story follows [[Killy]], a silent loner wandering 'The City', an endless, ever-growing maze of random walls, stairs, and doorways, in search for Net Terminal Genes. These genes, thought to be extinct, would allow humans to access the Netsphere, the control system for The City and hopefully putting an end to the unceasing growth.

title: nevermind
body:
"Nevermind" is the second studio album by the American [[rock (music)|rock]] band [[nirvana (band)|Nirvana]], released in 1991. The album features a mix of heavy and melodic songs, with themes of social alienation, personal conflict, and self-doubt. "Nevermind" is widely regarded as one of the most influential albums of the 1990s and helped popularize the "grunge" genre. The album's lead single, "Smells Like Teen Spirit," became a massive hit and helped Nirvana achieve worldwide fame. It is famous for its [[album cover]], which features a naked baby boy, [[swimming]] [[underwater]] in a [[pool]] while following a US one [[dollar bill]] attached to a [[fish hook|fishing line]].

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Nirvana":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nirvana_(band)]
* "Wikipedia: Nevermind":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nevermind]
* "Album cover link":[http://www.solarnavigator.net/music/music_images/Nirvana_Nevermind_album_cover.jpg]

title: fuu'un
body:
Fighing game series by [[SNK]]. 

The first game is called [b]Fuu'un Mokushiroku[/b] in Japan and [[Savage Reign]] elsewhere. 
This game is famous for its opening line: "[b]Fuu'un-Ken... A completely new art of fighting combined boomerang and karate art... [/b]" 

The second game is called [b]Fuu'un Super Tag Battle[/b] in Japan and [[Kizuna Encounter]] elsewhere. 
The setting of the games is the same as the [[Fatal Fury]] games but in the 21st century. 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Savage Reign":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Savage_Reign

title: ankha_zone_(meme)
body:
[b]Ankha Zone[/b] refers to an animation by [[Zone (artist)|]] (post #4351473) in tribute to an animation by [[Minuspal]] (post #4789190) featuring [[Ankha (animal crossing)|]] from [i][[Animal Crossing]][/i] having [[femdom]] [[sex]] with a [[Villager (animal crossing)|]] whilst keeping an [[expressionless|expressionless face]] and having her [[crossed arms|arms crossed]].

Parodies will often either include the character looking down on the viewer and swaying their hips to the music ("Camel by Camel" by [[Sandy Marton]], or in the case of the original minuspal animation, "Tower Power Pokey" from [[Paper Mario: Sticker Star]]), or emphasize Ankha's magic powers as displayed in the short animation.

h4. See also

* [[Egyptian Trend (meme)]] - 2025 animation meme

title: hybrid_insector
body:
A [[Kamen Rider]] fanfic webcomic series created by [[Shimizu Eiichi]] and [[Shimoguchi Tomohiro]], the authors of [[Kurogane no Linebarrel]]. 
Toei made a formal request to them in December 2011 for removing the comics from their site and the series was deleted without being completed. 

In the story, the government has decided to treat the Shouwa Kamen Riders as "vermin to be hunted down", right after the great evil was destroyed in the late 1980's.
other_names: ハイブリッド・インセクター

title: liliruca_arde
body:
A character in the [[dungeon_ni_deai_wo_motomeru_no_wa_machigatteiru_darou_ka|Danmachi]] franchise. She is of a fantasy race with very short stature and works as an assistant for adventurers.

Primarily her job is picking up dropped items from the monsters. She has stated that her small physique limits her combat ability greatly. In spite of her height she still has a notable bust. She has brown hair of varying length. Normally wears a cloak over a tight red top and short skirt which doesn't cover her waist. Her red top also includes a hood. 

There's confusion on how to romanize her name. "[[Liliruca Arde]]" is the most commonly used. Other variants are "Liliruka Aede", "Liliruca Aade" and "Liliruka Aade" 

Voiced by [[Uchida Maaya]].

h4. External links

* "DanMachi Wiki: Liliruca Arde":[https://danmachi.fandom.com/wiki/Liliruca_Arde]

title: hanae_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Member of the Remedial Knights. Her full name is Asagao Hanae.

She has [[blue eyes]], a [[pink halo]], [[very long hair|very long]] [[purple hair]], tied into [[twintails]], decorated with [[hairclip]]s and [[crossed bandaids|crossed]] [[bandaid hair ornament|bandaid]] and [[pill hair ornament]]s, a [[skin fang]] and [[large breasts]].

Her regular outfit consists of a [[nurse cap]], a [[white choker]], a [[short dress|short]] [[black dress|black]] [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[sailor dress]] with a [[white sailor collar]], a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[pink jacket]] with an [[armband]] held with a [[safety pin]], [[mismatched legwear|mismatched]] thighhighs (a [[pink thighhighs|pink]] [[striped thighhighs|stripped]] one and a [[white thighhighs|white]] one) a [[thigh holster|thigh]] [[syringe]] [[syringe holster|holster]] and [[mismatched footwear|mismatched]] shoes. She also carries a [[stuffed rabbit]].

Her personal weapon is an [[L85]] [[assault rifle]].

Voiced by: [[Yuuki Kana (voice actor)|]]
Original artist: [[tonito]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #5442046: Default

title: underbust
body:
Clothing worn under the bustline, lifting or accentuating the [[breasts]]. The top edge of the outer garment should ideally rest just underneath the bust. 

h4. Examples
* !post #2401122
* !post #8853038

Some clothing styles that incorporate this feature are [[maid]] uniforms, [[waitress]] uniforms (particularly from the [[Anna Miller]] and [[Kobeya]] restaurant chains), the [[dirndl]], most [[corset]]s, and the [[virgin killer outfit]].

[[Dress ribbon]] and [[rei no himo]] tied directly under the breasts also count as underbust.

For clothing that encloses all sides of the bust, use [[framed breasts]]. 

Not to be confused with [[underboob]], which refers to the exposed bottom part of the breasts.

h4. See also

* [[chest harness]]
* [[corset]]
* [[dirndl]]
* [[empire waist]]
* [[framed breasts]]

title: red_len
body:

Her color scheme is a red and black outfit with a purple hair bow (often worn [[low-tied_long_hair|lower]] in fan art to make her more visually distinct from the original Lens), [[purple eyes]] and [[grey hair|grey]] or [[white hair]]. 

Originally created as a familiar, she lives and works at an antique shop, but otherwise acts independently. She enjoys smoking and drinking (especially bourbon).

title: mega_man_x_dive
body:
Mega Man X DiVE is a mobile platform game from the [[Mega Man X (series)|]] series. It was released on March 2020 and ended services on July 2024. An offline version of the game was released on September 2023 on Steam.

The game follows the story of the Player and a navigator of the "Deep Log", [[RiCO (mega man)|]]. Deep Log is where the game data of the Player are stored as well as the data of the beloved game series Mega Man X.

The Player works alongside RiCO to fix the anomalies that happened within the Deep Log that is causing the corruption of the Mega Man X games, causing the data of various games within and outside of the X series to get mingled together.

h4. New characters

He has a similar physical appearance to X, with [[red eyes]] and [[slit pupils]], a black and golden armor and a purple gem in his helmet. A streak runs from under his eyes to his cheeks.

body:
A fictional, hostile [[robot]] race from the [[Choujikuu Seiki Orguss]] [[mecha]] anime [[science fiction]] TV series from the 80s. They are the main antagonists in the show.

The [b]Mu[/b] are a very advanced robotic civilization that possess a massive army of several powerful combat [[spacecraft]], fighter [[aircraft]] and several different [[mecha]]. [spoilers]They come from an [[alternate_universe|alternate dimension]] where an "A.I. singularity":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Technological_singularity caused advanced robots to rebel and erradicate the human race. The Mu robot race are the result of this catasthrophic apocalyptic event.[/spoilers]

title: padme_amidala
body:
A [[Star Wars]] character played by [[Natalie Portman]]. She first appeared in [[Star Wars: The Phantom Menace |The Phantom Menace]] as the teenage Queen of Naboo, and after her reign, becomes a senator and an anti-war activist in the Galactic Senate. 

[spoiler]She secretly marries [[Anakin Skywalker]], then later dies while giving birth to twins [[Luke Skywalker]] and [[Princess Leia|Leia Organa]]. Anakin's fear of losing Padmé serves as the catalyst in driving him to the dark side of the Force and becoming [[Darth Vader]].[/spoiler]

title: kikou_souseiki_mospeada
body:
[b]Kikou Souseiki Mospeada[/b] (機甲創世記モスピーダ lit. [b]Armored Genesis Mospeada[/b], known in English as [i][b]Genesis Climber Mospeada[/b][/i]) is a [[science fiction]] [[mecha]] anime TV series created by Aramaki Shinji and Kakinuma Hideki. It is the first series of the [[MOSPEADA]] franchise.

The 25-episode television series ran from late 1983 to early 1984 in Japan. The show is set in the year 2083, when the Earth faces an alien occupation that has lasted 33 years.

[[Mospeada (mecha)|]] stands for "[b]M[/b]ilitary [b]O[/b]peration [b]S[/b]oldier [b]P[/b]rotection [b]E[/b]mergency [b]A[/b]viation [b]D[/b]ive [b]A[/b]rmor", one of the transformable [[motorcycle]]-[[power armor]]s the series features. 

The other primary mecha featured in the show are the three-form transformable fighter called the Armo-Fighter AFC-01 [[Legioss]] and another three form heavy mecha called AB-01 [[Tread]].

All the human and alien mechanical designs for the series were created by [[Aramaki Shinji]] and [[Kakinuma Hideki]] respectively.

Mospeada became [b][i]The New Generation[/i][/b] in the [[ROBOTECH]] American adaptation of the series.

h4. Characters
* [[Stick Bernard]]

title: choujikuu_kidan_southern_cross
body:
[i][b]Choujikuu Kidan Setan Kurosu[/b][/i], known in English as [i][b]The Super Dimension Cavalry Southern Cross[/b][/i], was the third Japanese [[science fiction|Sci-Fi]] [[mecha]] anime series released under the "Super Dimension" moniker by the sponsor [[Big West]]. It aired weekly from April 15, 1984 until September 30, 1984.

The Southern Cross followed [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross|The Super Dimension Fortress Macross]] (1982-1983) created by Studio Nue with Artland and produced by Tatsunoko, and [[Choujikuu Seiki Orguss|The Super Dimension Century Orguss]] (1983-1984), also created by Studio Nue with Artland and produced by Tokyo Movie Shinsha.

The three titles share some of the same creators and staff, and [[MACROSS]] is referenced by character cameos and inside references by the latter two series. However, the basic stories are unrelated. Southern Cross was the least successful of the 'Super Dimensional' banner and was actually canceled due to low ratings, forcing the scriptwriters to hastily conclude the anime. The series lasted for 23 episodes. 

Unlike the other two series, The Southern Cross was created and produced almost entirely by [[tatsunoko_pro|Tatsunoko]] with mechanical designs by its sister studio Ammonite (Ogawa Hiroshi, Ohkura Hirotoshi and Ono Takashi). The characters of the show were designed by [[Kogawa Tomonori]], [[Kitazume Hiroyuki]] and Sonoda Miyo.

Most of the animation of The Southern Cross (with edited content and revised dialogue) was adapted outside Japan for the second part of [[ROBOTECH]], following [b]The Macross Saga[/b], and preceding [b]The New Generation[/b]. In this form, it is frequently referred to as [b]Robotech Masters[/b] (as it was titled in the comic book adaptation released by Comico) or also [b]The Masters Saga[/b].

title: ookami_(game)
body:
[i]Ookami[/i] is a game developed by the now closed Clover Studios, a former subsidiary of Capcom.

[i]Ookami[/i] follows the story of the sun god [[Amaterasu (ookami)|]], who is in the form of a white wolf and accompanied by the diminutive [[Issun]] as she battles evil demons such as [[Yamata no Orochi (ookami)|]].

The unique graphics of the game make it seem like a painting on a scroll. Using the Celestial Brush, Amaterasu can use her powers to alter reality, such as drawing a line to cut something in half, drawing a bomb to blow something up, and filling in areas to restore broken or missing objects.

The title of the game is a pun. "Okami" means "great deity", but with a different character system, it can also mean "wolf".

Has a [[Nintendo DS]] sequel, [i][[Ookamiden]][/i]. Amaterasu has made a playable appearance in [i][[Marvel vs. Capcom 3]][/i].

title: kino_makoto
body:
The brown-haired character from the series [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]] (aka. Pretty Soldier Sailor Moon) by [[Takeuchi Naoko]]. She is physically [[muscular female|very strong]], and the [[height difference|tallest girl]] compared to her close friends. She's also noted for having the [[large breasts|largest bust]] among her friends (who are rather curvy in their own right).

Despite her tough appearance, she is very gentle. She is also a good cook and signed up for home economics.

Voiced by the late [[Shinohara Emi]] in the 90s anime, and [[Koshimizu Ami]] in Crystal.

title: sailor_saturn
body:
She is one of the [[Outer Senshi]] from the series [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]] and the last planetary [[Sailor Senshi]] discovered. Of all the Sailor Senshi, Saturn makes the fewest appearances in the anime. Her civilian name is [[Tomoe Hotaru]].

She carries a scythe weapon called the [[Silence Glaive]] and a large part of her powers are associated with silence and destruction. Her two most notable offensive moves are [[Silence Glaive Surprise]] and [[Death Reborn Revolution]], plus a defensive Silence Wall move.

h4. See also

* [[Super Sailor Saturn]]
* [[Super Sailor Saturn (Stars)]]

title: death_reborn_revolution
body:
An attack used by [[Sailor Saturn]]. It is never seen in the 90s anime, but is seen in the [[bishoujo senshi sailor moon s|third season]]’s final battle against [[Pharaoh 90]] in both the manga and [[bishoujo senshi sailor moon crystal|Crystal]]. This is an extremely powerful attack that causes purple ribbons to swirl around Saturn’s [[Silence Glaive]], generating strong winds that decimate anything in their path. It is strong enough to suck Pharaoh 90 out of the earth, forcing him to try and return to his home world to escape her.

Note that there is a separate attack called [i]Death Ribbon Revolution[/i], but the katakana for [i]ribbon[/i] (リボン) is slightly different from [i]reborn[/i] (リボーン), and the move only shows up in a fighting game. They appear visually similar, so the [i]reborn[/i] variant originating from the manga is used here.
other_names: デス・リボーン・レボリューション

title: der_untergang
body:
The original German title of Oliver Hirschbiegel's 2004 war film [b]Downfall[/b], depicting the final days of [[World War II]] in [[Nazi]] [[Germany]] and the life of [[Adolf Hitler]] and his aides inside the Berlin bunker. Notable for a scene in which Hitler is informed by his generals that his ordered counterattack on the approaching [[Soviet Army|Soviet forces]] did not take place, causing him to furiously rant about how everyone, particularly his military staff, has failed him. Other scenes of him or others ranting have resulted in parodies with altered subtitles in which they rant about anything, creating a meme.

h4.See also
* [[meme]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Downfall (2004 film)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Downfall_%282004_film%29#Parodies
* "Know Your Meme: [Downfall / Hitler Reacts]":http://knowyourmeme.com/memes/downfall-hitler-reacts

title: bondage_mittens
body:
Pouch-like coverings that fasten securely around the wrists, holding the hands closed or palms flat. They are often used in [[BDSM]] play such as [[pony play]] or [[pet play]]. Unlike [[mittens]] for cold-weather use, bondage mittens are tubes or bags without a separate thumb and are typically made of [[leather]] or some other stiff material to prevent the wearer from grasping through the material of the mittens.

There are several specialised designs that differ from the standard look:

* !post #7966668: [[paw gloves|Paw mittens]]
* !post #7134904: [[hoof gloves|Hoof mittens]]
* !post #3506677: Metal mittens

h4. See also
* [[armbinder]]
* [[taped hands]]

h4. External links
"Wikipedia: Medical Restraints":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Medical_restraint#Types]

title: ultra_galaxy_mega_dai-kaijuu_battle
body:
The 22nd and 23rd installments of the long-running [[Ultra Series]], and the start of the [[Ultra Galaxy (series)|]] sub-series. It adapts the concept of the [i]Dai-Kaijuu Battle: ULTRA MONSTERS[/i] [[carddass]] arcade game, itself the start of the Dai-Kaijuu Battle sub-series (covering the arcade games and ports, manga, and this show), and features an original plot.

Unlike previous entries, this show does not focus on Ultramen, instead focusing on [[kaiju]] battling each other, akin to [[Pokemon]] (itself inspired by [[Ultraseven (series)|]]'s Capsule Monsters). It follows the ZAP SPACY team, and in particular, [[Reimon]], a Reionic, who can summon kaiju to fight with using his Battlenizer.

h4. See also

* [[Dai-Kaijuu Battle Ultra Ginga Densetsu The Movie]]

h4.External links

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ultra_Galaxy_Mega_Monster_Battle

title: martina_crespi
body:
Character from [[Strike Witches: Kurenai no Majo-tachi]].

A Sergeant from Romagna serving in the [[504th Joint Fighter Wing]]. Member of the Pantaloni Rossi trio with [[Luciana Mazzei]] and [[Fernandia Malvezzi]]. She studied ballet, but is more interested in soccer.
Her familiar is a Bolognese dog, her weapon is an MG42 machine gun, and she's based on Giampiero Crespi.

title: saratoga_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the US Navy aircraft carrier USS [i]Saratoga[/i] (CV-3). 
Character designed by [[Saru]], voiced by [[Uesaka Sumire]].

A jarringly young-looking girl with an equally childish and girly personality. She has [[long hair|long]], [[pink hair]] in [[twintails]] with an [[ahoge]] while wearing a [[hairband]] with a [[smokestack]]-like accessory. She wears a [[backless outfit|backless-like]], [[sleeveless dress]] with a [[black ribbon]] on it, and an attached cannon. Underneath it was a [[military uniform]] with an [[armband]]. She also wears [[black pantyhose]] and [[elbow gloves]] as well as carrying a [[staff]] with a [[flight deck]]-like banner. She has [[small breasts]] that she's conscious of compared to the much more endowed [[illustrious (azur lane)|Illustrious]] and [[Ranger (azur lane)|Ranger]]. The fact that she has them at all tends to be forgotten by others, including her own artist, [[Saru]] as seen in a number of her skins.

title: yoo_jin-ho
body: A supporting character from the South Korean multimedia franchise [[Solo Leveling]]. After main character [[Sung Jin-Woo]] saved him from criminal hunters, he became very devoted to him, started to call him "hyung-nim" (Korean for "elder brother [of a male sibling]", which is used as honorific to show respect to any elder male, even if he's not a blood-related brother) and became the vice-guild master of the guild Jin-Woo founded.

title: ryuushen_(3rd_costume)
body:
The third [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Nijisanji]]'s [[Ryuushen]]. This is their current default costume from April 2019 onward. 

The costume consists of a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[black shirt|black]] [[crop top]], a [[brown choker]], [[black bridal gauntlets|black]] [[bridal gauntlets]], a [[white jacket]] (usually worn [[off shoulder]]) with sleeves going [[sleeves past fingers|past their fingertips]], a large [[grey loincloth|grey]] [[print loincloth|print]] [[loincloth]] worn over [[black pants]], and [[black shoes|black]] [[flats]] with [[no socks]]. They have [[multiple piercings]] on both ears, including a [[tassel earrings|tassel earring]], and there is an option for [[round eyewear|round]] [[glasses]] with a [[eyewear strap|strap]]. Ryuushen holds a [[stuffed panda]] with this costume.

h4. Appearance

title: fire_escape
body:
A fire escape is a kind of emergency exit that is usually mounted to the outside of a building— They may be inside but in an area separated from the main building. They consist of a number of horizontal platforms, one at each story of a building, with [[stairs]] or [[ladder|ladders]] connecting them. The platforms and stairs are usually made of open metal gratings in order to prevent the build-up of ice, leaves, and snow— They may be made of [[concrete]] instead, especially if they are indoors.

They provide a method of evacuation in the event of a fire or other emergency that would make the stairwells inside the building inaccessible. They are most commonly found on multi-story residential buildings.

title: a-10_thunderbolt_ii
body:
The [b]A-10 Thunderbolt II[/b] is a straight-winged twin-tailed subsonic [[jet]] that entered service with the US Air Force in 1977. It is powered by two turbofans mounted in pods above the fuselage. Designed exclusively for close air support, the single-pilot Warthog can carry copious amounts of bombs, rockets, and missiles, but its best-known features are its [[GAU-8]] Avenger cannon and its ability to tolerate battle damage and remain operational.

h4. See also

* [[List of airplanes]]
* Wikipedia: "Fairchild Republic A-10":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fairchild_Republic_A-10_Thunderbolt_II
* [[Area 88]]

title: f-20_tigershark
body:
An advanced development of the Northrop [[F-5 Freedom Fighter]] Tiger II [[jet]] fighter that began in 1975 and first flew in 1982. The [b]Northrop F-20 "Tigershark"[/b] had small leading edge root extensions, a flattened nose, and a single F404 "turbofan":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turbofan. 

Despite proving to be a very capable multirole light combat aircraft during trials, only a few prototypes were developed and the jet was never mass produced. The project was finally cancelled in 1986.

h4. See also

* [[List of airplanes]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Northrop F-20 Tigershark":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northrop_F-20_Tigershark

title: hey_arnold!
body: Hey Arnold! is an American animated sitcom created by Craig Bartlett for [[Nickelodeon]]. It originally aired from October 7, 1996, to June 8, 2004. The show centers on fourth grader [[Arnold Shortman]], who lives with his grandparents in an inner-city tenement in the fictional city of Hillwood. Episodes center on his experiences navigating urban life while dealing with the zany hijinks he and his friends encounter. Many episodes, however, focus on other characters, including major, secondary, supporting, and even minor characters.

title: fate/strange_fake
body:
A light novel and manga series set in the [[Fate (series)|Fate universe]], written by [[Narita Ryohgo (mangaka)|]] and illustrated by [[Morii Shizuki]].

Originally an approved [[Fate/stay night]] fanfiction intended to be the introduction for a role playing style game by [[Narita Ryohgo (mangaka)|]]. Initially released as ''Fake/states night'' for a Type-MOON [[April Fools]] Day joke, then later rereleased in the form of a novel included as an extra with the magazine Type-MOON Ace 2. Eventually got an official light novel series and manga adaptation.

The plot centers around a Grail War faultily copied from the Third Holy Grail War in Fuyuki. The story is set in Snowfield, a fictional city in the United States located just outside of Las Vegas.

h4. Characters

h6. False Servants

* [[No Name Assassin (fate)|]] (False Assassin; Master: [[Jester Karture]])
* [[Jack the Ripper (fate/strange fake)|]] (False Berserker; Master: [[Flat Escardos]])
* [[Alexandre Dumas (fate)|]] (False Caster; Master: [[Orlando Reeve]])
* [[Enkidu (fate)|]] (False Lancer; Master: [[Wolf (fate)|]])
* [[Gilgamesh (fate)|]] (False Archer; Master: [[Tine Chelc]])
* [[Pale Rider (fate)|]] (False Rider; Master: [[Kuruoka Tsubaki]])

h6. True Servants

* [[Alcides (fate)|]] (True Archer; Master: [[Bazdilot Cordelion]])
* [[Richard I (fate)|]] (True Saber; Master: [[Sajou Ayaka (fate/strange fake)|]])
* [[Hippolyta (fate)|]] (True Rider; Master: Doris Lusendra)
* [[True Assassin (fate/strange fake)|]] (Master: [[Faldeus Dioland]])
* [[Francois Prelati (fate)|]] (True Caster; Master: [[Francesca Prelati (fate)|]])
* [[Huwawa (fate)|]] (True Berserker; Master: [[Haruri Borzak]])

title: bakugou_katsuki
body:
Deuteragonist of [[Boku no Hero Academia]], and [[Midoriya Izuku]]'s rival since childhood. His Quirk allows him to produce explosions from the sweat on his hands. Bakugou is very aggressive and short-tempered, often yelling at others or threatening to kill them. He has a superiority complex and hates being looked down on.

Bakugou has [[spiked hair|spiked]] [[blonde hair]] and [[red eyes]]. He is the only student in Class 1A who does not wear a tie with his [[school uniform]].

title: flat_escardos
body:
[[Fate/strange Fake]] character. The Master of [[Jack the Ripper (fate/strange fake)|]] (False Berserker).

He is one of the students under tutor of [[Lord El-Melloi II]]. A talented magus with a personality that is best described as "carefree", "naive", and "good-hearted", he joined Snowfield Holy Grail War to befriend humans and servants alike.

h4. See also

* [[List of Fate series characters]]

h4. External links

* "Type-Moon Wiki: Flat Escardos":[https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Flat_Escardos]

title: bakugou_mitsuki
body:
Character in [[Boku no Hero Academia]]. Mother of [[Bakugou Katsuki]] and wife to [[Bakugou Masaru]].

Her Quirk, [i]Glycerin[/i], allows her to secrete a smooth liquid from her skin. This would combine with Masaru's [i]Oxidizing Sweat[/i], which gives his sweat the same properties as nitric acid, into their son Katsuki's signature [i]Explosion[/i] Quirk. Furthermore, she has passed on her [[blonde hair]] and short fuse to her son, as Mitsuki is demonstrated to be similarly temperamental.

title: don_quixote_(fate)
body:
Lancer-class servant from [[Fate/Grand Order]] introduced in the [[Traum (fate/grand order)|]] chapter. The [[alonso quixano|eponymous protagonist]] from the [[don quixote (novel)|Spanish novel of the same name]].

A day-dreaming and lowly noble who underwent adventures to revive chivalry and serve his country. He is accompanied by [[Sancho Panza (fate)|]], his squire and partner. In contrast to other servants, as his ascension level increases his [[armor]] gets dingier.

[spoiler]He was initially summoned to the [[Atlantis (fate/grand order)|]] Lostbelt, but fled after watching other servants be defeated. He and Sancho arrived in the Traum singularity, where he posed as [[Karl der Grosse (fate)|]] and led the Righteous Realm.[/spoiler]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Murayama Ryota]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Tobita Nobuo]]

title: sancho_panza_(fate)
body:
A woman who accompanies [[Don Quixote (fate)|]] when he is summoned as a servant. She shares her name with the squire [[Sancho Panza]] from [[Don Quixote (novel)|]], but also incorporates elements of other characters, such as his horse [[Rocinante]], the prankster Altisidora, and his imaginary princess [[Dulcinea del Toboso]].

She appears as a [[horse girl]] who, depending on the ascension level, is either dressed as a [[maid]] or a [[princess]]. Her primary goal is to keep Quixote out of harm. [spoiler]She was the one who helped Quixote flee from the [[Atlantis (fate/grand order)|]] Lostbelt, and orchestrated his disguise as [[Karl der Grosse (fate)|]] in the [[Traum (fate/grand order)|]] singularity.[/spoiler]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Murayama Ryota]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Arai Satomi]]

body:
[b]The Abandoned Fantasy: End Sacrifice[br]Magical Girl Cruise ~Prisma Codes~[/b]
[quote]You awaken amidst unfamiliar scenery.

It's a land of enchantment, ruled by magical girls!
A chance encounter with a suspicious magic wand leads you to a certain young lady.
Utterly lost in this mysterious world, you set off together to search for her missing friend—[/quote]

title: kara_no_kyoukai/the_garden_of_order
body:
[b]Spiral Boundary, Ogawa-heim[br][b]the Garden of sinners/the Garden of Order[/b]
[quote]A ripple has appeared on the island nation where Singularity F was observed.
It draws Servants in, inescapable, inexorable.
At the end of the Rayshift stands the girl with Mystic Eyes of Death Perception.
But even with her help, uncovering the truth will not be easy...
[/quote]
A collaboration event in [[Fate/Grand Order]] with [[Kara no Kyoukai]], released on the Japanese server on February 25, 2016 and on the NA server on February 8, 2018. [[Ryougi Shiki|Ryougi Shiki (Assassin)]] is given to players as a reward for completing the event.

title: kaere!_ootsurudani_kitaku_club
body:
“Kaere! Ootsurudani Kitaku Club” (“Go Home! Ootsurudani Go-Home Club”) is a Japanese manga series by Tanaka Catapult, first serialized in June 2024 via Kodansha’s manga app “Magazine Pocket” (マガポケ).

The story follows three high school girls at Ootsuruya High School who don't join any official after-school clubs. Instead, they form the “Go-Home Club,” making their journey home from school a stage for mischief, exploration, and emotional growth. The main character, Sasamorikaede, is a new student who quickly gets swept into this chaotic but heartwarming daily routine.

h4. External links

* "Official Twitter":https://twitter.com/KaereKitakubu
other_names: 帰れ!大鶴谷帰宅倶楽部

title: kannazuki_no_miko
body:
[b]Kannazuki no Miko[/b] (lit. [i][[miko|Priestesses]] of the Godless Month[/i]) is a manga series created by the duo [[Kaishaku]]. The series was serialized in fourteen chapters by [i]Kadokawa Shoten[/i] and in [i]Shounen Ace[/i] in 2004 and 2005, and collected in two bound volumes. The series was adapted as an anime television series broadcast in 12 episodes on [i]TNK[/i] between October and December 2004. A drama CD was released on November 25, 2004 by [i]Geneon[/i] based on the anime version.

The series centers on the [[yuri]] relationship of the two main characters, [[kurusugawa_himeko|Himeko]] and [[himemiya_chikane|Chikane]], with elements of [[magical girl]] and [[mecha]] themes helping to carry the plot. An anime series that includes several characters similar to those of [i]Kannazuki no Miko[/i] called [i][[Kyoushirou to Towa no Sora]][/i] aired in Japan between January and March 2007.

Because it was one of the first yuri romances in an anime that was played as a straight romance, it's become iconic for yuri romance, especially its ED artwork, featuring the memetic [[miko embrace]].  (The pose is essentially synonymous with yuri.)

The manga and anime were originally released in English under the original Japanese title by Tokyopop and Geneon USA respectively. After Geneon USA's shutdown, distribution rights for the anime were transferred to Sentai Filmworks, who now distribute the series under the English title [b]Destiny of the Shrine Maiden[/b].

title: kaguya_madoka
body:
[[Star Twinkle Precure]] character. Civilian identity of [[Cure Selene]].

Kaguya Madoka/Cure Selene, a third year middle school student who does her best to be ladylike. She is from a family with a storied history: her father works in the government and her mother is a world-famous pianist. She herself holds national championship titles in piano and archery. She also does flower arrangement and tea ceremony, and gets excellent grades. As the student council president, she is known as the "moon" of her school.

title: amamiya_elena
body:
[[Star Twinkle Precure]] character. Civilian identity of [[Cure Soleil]].

Amamiya Elena/Cure Soleil, a third year middle school student with a radiant smile. She is the most popular girl in school, to the point where she is known as the school's "sun." She lives at a flower shop in the town's shopping district, where she sometimes works, and has six younger brothers and sisters whom she often takes care of in place of her busy parents.

title: hoshina_hikaru
body:
[[Star Twinkle Precure]] character. Civilian identity of [[Cure Star]].

Hoshina Hikaru/Cure Star, a second year middle school girl who loves the stars and constellations. She is full of imagination and curiosity. She investigates anything that interests her thoroughly, and acts on intuition.

title: golden_week
body:
April 29 to May 5.

In 1948, Japan introduced three (later four) public holidays during this week, making it a "golden time" for high recreational activity. It has since been further commercialized with promotional events and sales.

In 2021, artists began a trend of drawing characters in [[gold bikini]]s during Golden Week (beginning with post #4494511).

h4. See also

* [[Kodomo no Hi]] - public holiday in Japan on May 5

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Golden Bikini Week":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/events/golden-bikini-week]
* "Wikipedia: Golden Week (Japan)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Golden_Week_(Japan)]

title: hamakaze_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Hamakaze[/i]. 

She has [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] with [[hair over one eye|her bangs covering her right eye]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit is the uniform exclusive to her and the 17th Destroyer Division: a [[white shirt]] top with blue trim and [[blue sailor collar]], [[yellow neckerchief]], [[white gloves]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[brown pantyhose]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of a single hull piece to her back containing both her funnels, foremast, and a 12.7 cm twin gun mount, 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s, and a second 12.7 cm twin mount and 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]] as [[handgun]]s. 

Due to similarities in appearance, she is frequently compared to characters from other franchises, including [[Mash Kyrielight]] from [[Fate/Grand Order]], [[Rem (re:zero)|]] from [[Re:Zero Kara Hajimeru Isekai Seikatsu]] and occasionally [[Konpaku Youmu]] from [[Touhou]] and [[2B (Nier:Automata)|]] from [[Nier:Automata]].

title: chevrolet_camaro
body:
The Chevrolet Camaro is a mid-size American automobile manufactured by Chevrolet, classified as a pony car. 
It first went on sale on September 29, 1966, for the 1967 model year and was designed as a competing model to the Ford Mustang. 
The Camaro shared its platform and major components with the Firebird, produced by General Motors' Pontiac division that was also introduced for 1967.
Four distinct generations of the Camaro were developed before production ended in 2002. The nameplate was revived on a concept car that evolved into the fifth-generation Camaro; production started on March 16, 2009.

h4. Generations
* !post #4986384: [[chevrolet camaro (1st generation)|1st Generation]] (1967–1969)
* !post #7599029: [[chevrolet camaro (2nd generation)|2nd Generation]] (1970–1981)

title: jeddah_(mobile_suit)
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from [[Gundam]]. It appears in the [[Moon Gundam]] manga from 2017.

[b] RGM-88X Jeddah [/b]

An experimental prototype for the Federation's next generation mass produced [[mobile_suit|MS]] to replace the outdated [[GM III]]. The Jeddah's specifications were considered adequate, with even [[Amuro Ray]] giving his seal of approval for the design to be passed onwards, and as such it was further refined and simplified into the venerable [[Jegan]].

title: toriko_(39chan)
body:
A collaborative voicebank created by users of the imageboard [[39chan]] for [[april fools]] in 2025. TORIKO is a 23-year old girl female idol dressed in [[jirai kei]] fashion with two black [[hair bow|hair bows]] and [[twintails]], her left eye is [[hair over one eye|covered by her own hair]]. Progress on her started on January 2, 2025 with a DiffSinger AI voicebank announced on April 1st. However, this voicebank would be delayed, resulting in an UTAU one being created and released on April 27 instead. Her official artwork was illustrated by [[Melonenbrot]].

title: barack_obama
body:
[b]Barack Hussein Obama II[/b] (b. 4 August 1961) is an American [[politician]] who served as 44th president of the [[United States|United States of America]] from [[2009]] to [[2017]]. A member of the Democratic Party, he was the first African-American president in American history. Obama previously served as a U.S. senator representing Illinois and as an Illinois state senator. 

Born in Honolulu, [[Hawaii]], Obama graduated from Columbia University in [[1983]] with a Bachelor of Arts degree in political science and later worked as a community organizer in Chicago. In [[1988]], Obama enrolled in Harvard Law School, where he was the first black president of the Harvard Law Review. He became a [[lawyer|civil rights attorney]] and an academic, teaching constitutional law at the University of Chicago Law School from [[1992]] to [[2004]]. In [[1996]], Obama was elected to represent the 13th district in the Illinois Senate, a position he held until [[2004]], when he successfully ran for the U.S. Senate. In the [[2008 presidential election]], after a close primary campaign against [[Hillary Clinton]], he was nominated by the Democratic Party for president. Obama selected [[Joe Biden]] as his running mate and defeated Republican nominee [[John McCain]] and his running mate [[Sarah Palin]]. He became popular in Japan in part due to the fact that he shares his last name with a city in the Fukui prefecture.

* !asset #25713339: 2012 inaugural portrait

Use this tag whenever President Obama is shown, or for works which imply his famous "Hope" or "Change" campaign posters, or for his campaign phrase, "Yes we can".

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:People]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barack_Obama]

title: metal_gear_survive
body:
A non-canon instalment in the Metal Gear franchise released in 2018, and is the first game in the series since the NES ports not to be produced by Hideo Kojima.

When announced in 2016, the game received bad reception from shifting the series into a survival horror setting instead of the political espionage it was known for. When the game was released, more flaws were discovered, such as paying for save slots and reused assets from the previous game.

title: honk_honk_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originating from [[4chan]] which developed in two ways, though typically associated with [[Touhou]]'s [[Chen]] today.

The earlier of the two was based on the episodes titled "The Alien Costume" from [[Spider-Man: The Animated Series]]. In Part 3 (Episode 9), Spider-Man attempts to escape by jumping on a train, causing Eddie Brock (as [[Venom (Marvel)|]]) to steal a truck and ride alongside the train, honking the truck horn. This version of the meme would merge into the later and more popular of the two, inspired by the first Touhou comic drawn by [[bkub]], post #244234, which featured Chen honking the horn of a bicycle.

On 4chan, this would inspire crossover art with Venom honking the horn of a bicycle instead of a truck, before the Venom meme faded entirely in favor of the Chen meme.

title: yamaha_pacifica
body:
Line of solid-body [[electric guitar]]s designed and manufactured by Japanese maker [[Yamaha]] since 1989. 

Its original and now-classic inception is based on [[fender_musical_instruments_corporation|Fender]]'s [[Fender Stratocaster]] with the main differences being a much rounder body with longer horns, a different headstock with Yamaha's logo, a distinctly shaped smaller pickguard on higher end models, and an output jack mounted on the side of the body instead of its front.

title: ushio_(kancolle)
body: [[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Ushio[/i]. Character design by [[Drew (drew213g)|]], voiced by [[Hayasaka Kozue]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with an [[ahoge]], and [[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit is the Special Type's [[serafuku]] and [[black_socks|black]] [[kneehighs]]. Her [[cannon|12.7 cm twin gun mount]] is colored pink, and which has a [[:3]] face upon its top so that looking down at it, the cannon barrels look like ears on a bunny. She normally hugs her cannon tightly to her chest (to hide her chest, presumably). She has [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]] with a notable [[ahoge]]. The [[torpedo tubes]] strapped to her thighs have puppy, kitty, bunny, and other cartoon animal [[sticker]]s on them. Her damaged CG reveals that she's hiding surprisingly [[large breasts]] for a destroyer/young girl. The reason for this may be that "Ushi" is the word for "cow", so she has "Ushi Oppai", or "cow tits", which is how some Japanese mock women with larger-than-normal cup sizes. Historically, the real-life [i]Ushio[/i] took part in many of the IJN's operations and was one of the extremely few surviving Japanese destroyers of [[World War II]], alongside only [[Yukikaze (kancolle)|]] and [[Hibiki (kancolle)|]] of the ships in the game. Also famous for being a "lucky" ship, she is unlike [[Yukikaze (Kancolle)|]] and [[Shigure (Kancolle)|]] in the sense that she protected her companions instead of jinxing them. h4. title: translated
body:
A post that has been fully translated into English. See [[translation request]] for untranslated posts.

This tag only applies to fully translated posts. If the translation is incomplete or needs review, use [[partially translated]] or [[check translation]] instead. When the post is fully translated, remove the [[translation request]] tag and add [[translated]].

Additionally, it's okay to leave out the [[translated]] tag on posts with very small and insubstantial notes, such as single onomatopoeia that could just as well go untranslated. Anything more substantial than that should be tagged [[translated]].

See [[howto:translate]] for guidelines on how to translate.

h4. Related tags

* [[alternate language]]
* [[check translation]]
* [[hard-translated]]
* [[hard-translated (non-english)]]
* [[partially translated]]

title: sazanami_(kancolle)
body: [[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Sazanami[/i], and one of the five starter ships. Character design by [[Drew (drew213g)|]], voiced by [[Hayasaka Kozue]]. She has [[pink eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[pink hair]] in [[twintails]] held with [[hair bobbles]]. On her lower right waist is a round [[badge]] with a strawberry-like pattern. When heavily damaged, she is revealed to be wearing [[strawberry print]] [[strawberry panties|panties]]. She has a tiny pink [[rabbit]] companion. The 7th Destroyer Division (Sazanami, [[Akebono (kancolle)|]], [[Ushio (kancolle)|]] and [[Oboro (kancolle)|]]) all wear a variant of the Fubuki-class standard [[serafuku]] as well as dark green versions of the Fubuki-class ship parts and rigging. She talks in random pop-culture references, memes and internet slang and refers to the [[Admiral (kancolle)|]] as "master" as if she was a [[maid]] in a [[maid cafe]] (her new remodel CG emphasizes this point). h4. title: oboro_(kancolle)
body: [[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Oboro[/i]. Character design by [[Drew (drew213g)|]], voiced by [[Hayasaka Kozue]]. She has [[short_hair|short]] [[brown hair]], [[brown eyes]], and [[medium breasts]]. Her default outfit is the Special Type's [[serafuku]] ([[white shirt]], [[blue sailor collar]], [[blue skirt]]), and a [[bandaid]] on [[bandaid_on_face|her cheek]]. Her [[rigging]] is also shared with the rest of the Special Types: a funnel backpack, 12.7 cm twin gun mount, and 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s. Her real-life counterpart had a problem with [[crab]]s getting into her, so her official art shows a crab peeking out of her smokestack. She is frequently depicted in fanart having the crab with her 24/7 such as on her [[animal on head|head]] or [[animal on shoulder|shoulder]] and treating it as a [[pet]]. Sometimes fanart will also depict crabs crawling out of her turrets when she least expects it. h4. title: ootomari_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese icebreaker/fleet oiler [i]Ootomari[/i]. Character design by [[Hozuka (kadokawa)|]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied to a [[braided ponytail]], and [[yellow eyes]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white dress]] top, [[blue skirt]], [[blue cloak]], [[white pantyhose]], and [[grey shoes|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of a miniature version of the real-life ship to her right side and held at waist-level, and a [[briefcase]]. She uses a 76 mm [[handgun]] mount at kai form, reflective of her wartime duties.

Original designs from the late 1970s only had one [[fender_precision_bass|Precision]]-style pickup with following models featuring a plethora of pickup configurations and hardware options, with the most common one being a 4 string double cutaway [[PJ bass]] with 4-in-line tuners.

title: pyramid_of_khafre
body: One of the three principal [[ancient Egyptian]] pyramids at Giza, built as the tomb of the Fourth Dynasty Pharaoh Khafre (reigned ca. 2558–2532 BC), whose name is also somettimes rendered "Chephren" in English. The Pyramid of Khafre is slightly smaller than the [[great_pyramid_of_giza|Great Pyramid of Khufu]], his father, but looks larger from most angles because it stands on higher ground, so is often mistaken for the Great Pyramid in photo captions.  It is distinguishable by the fact that some of its smooth outer cladding still exists near the peak.

title: jaguar
body:
The jaguar (Panthera onca), also known in South America as (painted) onça, is the only extant Panthera species native to the Americas.

The jaguar is the largest cat species in the Americas and the third-largest after the [[tiger]] and the [[lion]]. This spotted cat closely resembles the [[leopard]], but is usually larger and sturdier. It ranges across a variety of forested and open terrains, but its preferred habitat is tropical and subtropical moist broadleaf forest, swamps and wooded regions. The jaguar enjoys swimming and is largely a solitary, opportunistic, stalk-and-ambush predator at the top of the food chain. As a keystone species it plays an important role in stabilizing ecosystems and regulating prey populations.

The jaguar has an exceptionally powerful bite, even relative to the other big cats. Given its historical distribution, the jaguar has featured prominently in the mythology of numerous indigenous American cultures, including those of the Maya and Aztec.


h5. For characters with jaguar characteristics
* [[Jaguar girl]]
* [[Jaguar boy]]

title: gashadokuro
body:
A mythical [[giant skeleton]] in modern Japanese mythology.

Gashadokuro, also known as Odokuro, or ("starving skeleton") are giant skeletons that are fifteen times taller than an average person. If a Gashadokuro sees a human, it will grab it and attempt to bite its head off with its giant teeth. Gashadokuro are created from gathering bones from people who have died of starvation. The only way a Gashadokuro can be detected before it appears is by hearing a ringing in one's ears.

h4. Appearance

title: hagoromo_lala
body:
[[Star Twinkle Precure]] character. Civilian identity of [[Cure Milky]].

Hagoromo Lala/Cure Milky, an alien from planet Samaan. She is 13 years old in Earth years, but she is treated as an adult on her home planet. She goes on a journey on a rocket with [[Prunce (precure)|]] and [[Fuwa (precure)|]] to find the legendary Precure, and ends up on Earth. She has a strong sense of responsibility, but sometimes makes mistakes.

Lala has short [[aqua hair|aqua]]/[[blue hair]] with [[pink hair|pink]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] and [[aqua eyes|aqua]]/[[blue eyes]] with [[star-shaped pupils]]. Lala wears a [[yellow jacket|yellow]] [[cropped jacket]] with [[short sleeves]] and a [[blue sailor collar]], a [[necklace]], a [[white dress]], a [[single glove|single]] [[aqua gloves|aqua]] [[fingerless gloves|fingerless glove]], a [[blue belt]] with a [[belt pouch|pouch]] strapped to it, [[loose socks|loose]] [[yellow socks]] and [[shoes]].

title: prunechi
body:
[[Original]] character of the [[Arca.live]] / [[Ruliweb]] [[commission|commissioner]] "빘치":[https://arca.live/u/@%EB%B9%98%EC%B9%98]/"킹받네진짜":[https://bbs.ruliweb.com/timeline?user=3266638]. She's a custom character of the [[lyn (blade & soul)|Lyn]] race and Blade Dancer (린검사) class from the MMORPG [[Blade & Soul]]. However, her appearance differs from the common Lyn, and furthermore, she has been drawn by various artists in different styles, wearing costumes outside Blade & Soul, and with alternate proportions. Therefore, she's often considered a character on her own.

She has [[red eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]], a [[cat tail]] and [[cat ears]] (though ears can be ambiguous [[animal ears]]), as well as three moles: [[mole under eye|under her eye]], [[mole on breast|on her breast]] and [[mole on thigh|on her thigh]]. Her main apparel consists of a [[cat ear hairband]], an [[animal collar]] with a [[neck bell|bell]], an [[off shoulder]] [[red jacket]], a [[white one-piece swimsuit]], matching [[white thighhighs]], and a pair of [[red shoes|red]] [[nike (company)|Nike]] [[Air Jordan 1]]'s. She also often wears a [[cow print bikini]], with matching [[cow print thighhighs|thighhighs]] and [[cow print gloves|gloves]], as well as a [[cowbell]] and [[ear tag]].

h4. External links

title: miyamoto_musashi
body:
[b]Miyamoto Musashi[/b] is a famous [[samurai]] from the Sengoku era of Japan. He is reputed to be the best swordsman in the history of Japan, with 62 recorded victories in a sword duel, and has never been defeated once. He is known for being capable of killing a man at just 13 years old and his unique [[dual wielding]] swords technique.

body:
[b]Dungeon ni Deai wo Motomeru no wa Machigatteiru Darou ka?[/b] (lit. [i]Is It Wrong to Try to Pick Up Girls in a Dungeon?[/i], abbrev. [i]DanMachi[/i]) is a Japanese light novel series, written by Fujino Oomori and illustrated by [[Yasuda Suzuhito]].

SB Creative has published six volumes since January 2013 under their GA Bunko imprint. It has received a spin-off light novel series and three manga adaptations. An anime television series adaptation by [[J.C. Staff]] that started airing on April 3rd, 2015.
